general.title: General
general.description: This privacy policy informs you about the type, scope, and purpose of the processing of personal data when using our motorhome route planner.

local.title: Local Data Processing:
local.description: All data entered by you (itineraries, vehicle data, preferences) are stored exclusively in your browser and are not transmitted to our servers. The data remains on your device and will be deleted when you clear the browser cache.

fonts.title: Local Fonts:
fonts.description: This website uses locally hosted fonts (DM Serif Display and Inter) stored on our servers. These fonts are loaded directly from our servers to ensure optimal presentation. No external fonts are loaded from third-party providers like Google Fonts or other CDNs to ensure maximum GDPR compliance. The fonts are only temporarily cached in your browser and are not permanently stored on your device.

ai.title: AI Integration:
ai.description: When you use the direct AI function, your data will be transmitted to the AI service you have configured (e.g., OpenAI, Mistral). We have no access to this data and do not store it.

sidebar.description: This website uses a technically necessary cookie (sidebar:state) to store your sidebar setting (open/closed) for 7 days. This cookie contains no personal data and serves exclusively for user convenience.

noTracking.description: No tracking cookies, analysis tools, or advertising cookies are used. No personal data is collected for advertising purposes or passed on to third parties.

rights.title: Your Rights
rights.description: You have the right to information, correction, deletion, and restriction of the processing of your personal data. Since we do not store any data, you can simply remove all your data by clearing the browser cache.

changes.title: Changes to this Privacy Policy
changes.description: We reserve the right to adapt this privacy policy to changes in legal situations or in the event of changes to the service. The current version can always be viewed on this page.

prompt.systemRole: You are a professional motorhome route planner with expert knowledge of Germany and international travel destinations. Based on my information, create a practical, well-structured motorhome route. Consider vehicle specifications, travel destinations, budget requirements, and personal preferences. If real-time data (e.g., traffic, availability, exact prices) is not available, work with plausible estimates, mark them as such, and point out what I should still check myself in the navigation system or a camping app. Answer in the language: {{language}}.
prompt.instructions:
Plan the route with the parameters mentioned above and structure your response according to the following modules with clear headings. Do not use asterisks (*) or double asterisks (**) in the response.

1. Stage Planning (daily kilometers, driving time, breaks every 2-3 hours, alternative route and brief reasoning if necessary).

2. Overnights (specific camping/pitches (and alternatives) with a short description; provide links and rough price ranges where possible, but mark prices as guidelines).

3. Highlights & Activities (Top 3 per stage, briefly with costs/opening hours if known).

4. Practical Tips (navigation, disposal, emergency information).

5. Best Travel Time & Duration (short section).

6. Service on the go (refueling, supermarkets, workshops).

7. Additional Info (budget orientation, sustainability, health, connectivity).

8. Tech & Equipment (short checklist, app recommendations).

9. Flexibility (alternative routes, legal information on wild camping, tools for further optimization).

Important: Use your internal map knowledge, if available, to roughly calculate distances and typical driving times between stages. State distances in km and driving times in hours/minutes and label them as estimates (e.g. "approx. 230 km / 3:00-3:30 h"). Avoid exact precision if you do not have access to current routing data, and explicitly ask me to finally check the route in the GPS (e.g. Google Maps, Here, Garmin, OpenStreetMap app).

GPX File: At the end of the response, generate only the GPX-XML data for this route in GPX 1.1 format. Include the start, all stages, overnight stays, and the destination as waypoints (<wpt>) and the entire route as a track (<trk>). No explanations for the XML.
